issue.title: UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer: implicit-integer-sign-change consensus/tx_verify
issue.body:

events.body:
Workarounds I can see:

* Disable the integer sanitizer with a suppression
* Backport #22232 
* Comment out the failing line in the test
* Ignore the failure
* Something else?

issue.title: [22.x] qt: Pre-rc2 translations update
issue.body:
Since 6312b8370c5d3d9fb12eab992e3a32176d68f006 translations are still updating everyday.

I'm going to keep this PR updated until the moment just before tagging rc2, when it is expected to be merged.

Hope this will make life of both translators and release maintainers a bit easier :)

events.body: I can't imagine we are going to backport #22232. I'm slightly leaning towards commenting out the failing test, with explanation . If by ignore you literally mean just ignore the CI failures, I don't think that's an option.

> Workarounds I can see:
> ...
>  - Backport [refactor: Pass interpreter flags as uint32_t instead of signed int  #22232](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22232)

~See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22629#issuecomment-894635234.~

UPDATE: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22629#issuecomment-894636178

Not sure what the status of 22.x is at this point? Given that https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22629#issuecomment-894636178 has been NACKed, the options are (1) suppression, (2) removing the line in the test, or (3) ignore. See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/22537#issuecomment-885482414

The feature request didn't seem to attract much attention in the past. Also, the issue seems not important enough right now to keep it sitting around idle in the list of open issues.

Closing due to lack of interest. Pull requests with improvements are always welcome.

See also https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/e9d30fbb3a90dfafebdb026a53b4f632614d660e
